channel.title: Comments for Luna Station Quarterly
channel.description: Stellar Short Fiction by Women-Identified Writers Since 2010

item.title: Comment on Today’s the last day to submit applications! by Frank Montellano
item.dc:creator: Frank Montellano
item.description: I filled out an application. I did forget to mention that I am retired military.
item.content:encoded: I filled out an application. I did forget to mention that I am retired military.

item.title: Comment on Issue 051 Author Interview: Fiona Moore and “Misrule” by A Horror Story for Christmas – A Doctor Of Many Things
item.dc:creator: A Horror Story for Christmas – A Doctor Of Many Things
item.description: […] Just in time for the Twelve Days of Christmas, Luna Station Quarterly have put up an interview with me talking about my festive folk-horror short story “Misrule”. Find out my opinions on social justice, why I like happy endings, and how I was inspired by the movie The Blood on Satan’s Claw: https://lunastationquarterly.com/issue-051-author-interview-fiona-moore-and-misrule/ […]
item.content:encoded: […] Just in time for the Twelve Days of Christmas, Luna Station Quarterly have put up an interview with me talking about my festive folk-horror short story “Misrule”. Find out my opinions on social justice, why I like happy endings, and how I was inspired by the movie The Blood on Satan’s Claw: https://lunastationquarterly.com/issue-051-author-interview-fiona-moore-and-misrule/ […]

item.title: Comment on Modern-Day Sirens: Michelle Zauner by Experience Film
item.dc:creator: Experience Film
item.description: Zauner’s Joy is most striking to me. She dives into the dark, but her inner bliss is unconquerable.
item.content:encoded: Zauner’s Joy is most striking to me. She dives into the dark, but her inner bliss is unconquerable.

item.title: Comment on Issue 050 Author Interview: Elou Carroll and “Tatterdemalion” by Christopher O'Halloran
item.dc:creator: Christopher O'Halloran
item.description: Great interview! I gotta admit, I also did caw "Wiswoad."
item.content:encoded: Great interview! I gotta admit, I also did caw “Wiswoad.”

item.title: Comment on Modern-Day Sirens: Amethyst Kiah by tiffanyarpdaleo
item.dc:creator: tiffanyarpdaleo
item.description: Fantastic article, and what an inspiring young woman, I look forward to watching her rise up!
item.content:encoded: Fantastic article, and what an inspiring young woman, I look forward to watching her rise up! ♥
